title: Francis
occurrences: I'm just an army mule, and my name happens to be Francis.
The name is still Francis, with an i.
Francis, I'll have you made a corporal for this.
Mule? Francis!
Francis?
The mule, sir, Francis. He spelled it with an i.
What who told you? - Francis.
Francis? - Yes, sir. The mule.
Or do all the mules talk? - Just Francis, sir.
Francis? - That's the mule's name, Lieutenant.
Francis, it's me, the second lieutenant.
Francis! - All right!
I never put anything in writing. - But it's signed Francis.
Francis, you've stripped me. - We're all ready to go.
Who is this? - Francis.
Francis? Francis who? - Lieutenant, please.
Francis! But, you can't talk on the telephone.
What does it mean? - But quick. Francis.
You wish to get outside? - I must. I've gotta see Francis.
Francis, where are you?
Francis, you're hurt!
What were you saying, Francis?
Who are you talking to, Peter? - Francis.
I tell you, Francis can talk!
Francis, stop treating me like a child. Remember, I'm an officer.
Now wait a minute, Francis.
For heaven's sake, Francis, you're not sleeping!
Francis, they're coming! Look. Up there.
Perhaps you'd go and have a talk with Francis.
Yes, sir. Hello, Francis.
Francis, I'd like you to meet the commanding general.
Francis, the commanding general.
Francis is scared to death the army will discover he can talk. - What?
Well, what do we do? - Francis has been in the army for seven years
Francis, you and I have been through a lot together.
You, Francis, have done a truly magnificent job for the army.
Francis, the one thing I won't tolerate in my command is willful insubordination!
I tell you Francis can talk! Do you understand?
I'm sure Francis didn't say anything.
Col. Hooker, release Stirling and have him bring Francis here.
Francis didn't want to come. He's here under protest.
I'm sorry, Francis. An unfortunate development, but that's war.
Francis, I want you to meet Col. Hooker. He's been a bit skeptical.
It's a pleasure, Francis.
Now listen, Francis. This is no time for personal feelings.
Believe me, Francis, I don't know how the Japs got the news any more than you do.
Who did you talk to about Francis?
Sir? - Who did you talk to about Francis?
And I just happened to mention that Francis had talked to the general too.
Francis, I knew you wouldn't let the general down.
Use your head, Francis.
Now, just picture it, Francis.
But, Francis, think of my family.
Yes, sir. - Come on, Francis.
Silence, Francis, you'll speak when you're spoken to!
Thank you, Francis. I'm glad I have at least one jackass in my command.
Francis, these men are leading representatives of the press.
Francis, a little courtesy. That's an order.
Francis, how 'bout a couple of shots of you and the general?
But you couldn't do that, Francis.
Gee, Francis, it's only for a couple of days though.
Good-bye, Francis.
Fine. Proceed directly from the airport to the Pentagon. Francis will be there.
Take good care of Francis.
Francis crashed?
Francis's body wasn't there.
Is this the animal? - Yes, sir. This is Francis.
